visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing compositional layers of Earth's atmosphere using percent-stacked columns with custom metadata annotations

custom.info:
Outermost layer transitioning to space
Contains trace gases (H, He) in low density

Meteor ablation layer
Temperature decreases with altitude

Weather layer containing 80% atmospheric mass
Temperature decreases with altitude

visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a nominal composition of atmospheric layers using six categorical series with ordinal height relationships. Each layer's relative position is encoded through vertical stacking order rather than quantitative proportions. Synthetic values use uniform weighting (μ=1, σ=0) to force equal percentage bands, prioritizing schematic representation over physical scale accuracy. The column chart format was selected for its ability to show part-to-whole relationships through stacked segments, aligning with Tufte's principle of maximizing data density through direct labeling. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through position-based encoding (vertical order) and color-free differentiation (text labels). Axis removal focuses attention on layer sequence while data labels provide dual encoding of names and metric ranges. Tooltips deliver supplementary information without visual clutter.
